article_title: ECB to Leave Emergency Lending for Greek Banks Unchanged
article_text:
FRANKFURT—The European Central Bank Monday decided to maintain its ceiling on emergency lending to Greek banks, an ECB spokesman said, hours after the Greek government and its creditors agreed to a rescue deal that would unlock desperately needed financial assistance but also forces Athens to implement a fresh round of painful austerity measures.

The ECB’s decision, made in a conference call of its governing council, maintains a freeze on emergency liquidity assistance, or ELA, at about €89 billion ($99.21 billion) that...
